#!/bin/bash
#
# ZFS LiveCD Builder - Plugin System Integration
# Seamless integration between Plugin Framework v3.0 and existing systems
#
# Architecture: Plugin Integration Layer v3.0
# Dependencies: lib/common.sh, src/core/plugin-system.sh, advanced-features-installer.sh
# Integration API Version: 3.0
#

set -euo pipefail

# Plugin integration metadata
readonly PLUGIN_INTEGRATION_VERSION="3.0.0"
readonly PLUGIN_INTEGRATION_DATE="2025-08-12"
readonly INTEGRATION_API_VERSION="3.0"

# Source dependencies
readonly PLUGIN_INTEGRATION_DIR="$(dirname "$(readlink -f "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")")"
readonly ZFSLCD_BASE_DIR="${ZFSLCD_BASE_DIR:-$(dirname "$(dirname "$PLUGIN_INTEGRATION_DIR")")")}"

# shellcheck source=lib/common.sh
source "$ZFSLCD_BASE_DIR/lib/common.sh" || { echo "Failed to load common.sh"; exit 1; }
# shellcheck source=src/core/plugin-system.sh
source "$ZFSLCD_BASE_DIR/src/core/plugin-system.sh" || { echo "Failed to load plugin-system.sh"; exit 1; }

# Integration configuration
readonly INTEGRATION_CONFIG_DIR="${ZFSLCD_CONFIG_DIR:-$ZFSLCD_BASE_DIR/config}/integration"
readonly LEGACY_FEATURES_DIR="$ZFSLCD_BASE_DIR/src/features"
readonly MIGRATION_LOG_DIR="${ZFSLCD_LOG_DIR:-/var/log/zfs-livecd}/integration"

# Legacy feature mapping to new plugins
declare -A LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP
declare -A PLUGIN_TO_LEGACY_MAP
declare -A MIGRATION_STATUS
declare -g INTEGRATION_INITIALIZED=false

#
# Integration Initialization
#

# Initialize plugin system integration
plugin_integration_init() {
    log_info "Initializing Plugin System Integration v${PLUGIN_INTEGRATION_VERSION}"
    
    # Create required directories
    mkdir -p "$INTEGRATION_CONFIG_DIR" "$MIGRATION_LOG_DIR"
    
    # Initialize plugin system if needed
    if [[ "$PLUGIN_SYSTEM_INITIALIZED" != "true" ]]; then
        if ! plugin_system_init; then
            log_error "Failed to initialize plugin system for integration"
            return 1
        fi
    fi
    
    # Load legacy feature mappings
    _load_legacy_feature_mappings
    
    # Initialize migration tracking
    _init_migration_tracking
    
    # Set up unified build system integration
    _setup_unified_build_integration
    
    INTEGRATION_INITIALIZED=true
    log_info "Plugin system integration initialized successfully"
    return 0
}

# Load legacy feature mappings
_load_legacy_feature_mappings() {
    log_debug "Loading legacy feature mappings"
    
    # Map legacy features to new plugin system
    LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP=(
        ["hardware-unlocker"]="hardware-optimizer"
        ["firmware-tools-installer"]="firmware-analysis-tools"
        ["memory-forensics-suite"]="memory-forensics-suite"
        ["security-research-tools"]="security-research-tools"
        ["data-recovery"]="data-recovery-toolkit"
        ["kernel-dev-environment"]="kernel-development-suite"
        ["stress-testing"]="hardware-stress-suite"
        ["performance-monitoring"]="performance-monitor"
        ["network-boot-server"]="network-boot-server"
        ["persistence-layer-system"]="persistence-manager"
        ["auto-detect-configure"]="auto-configuration"
        ["diagnostic-report-generator"]="system-diagnostics"
    )
    
    # Create reverse mapping
    for legacy_feature in "${!LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP[@]}"; do
        local plugin_id="${LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP[$legacy_feature]}"
        PLUGIN_TO_LEGACY_MAP["$plugin_id"]="$legacy_feature"
    done
    
    log_debug "Loaded ${#LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP[@]} legacy feature mappings"
}

# Initialize migration tracking
_init_migration_tracking() {
    for legacy_feature in "${!LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP[@]}"; do
        MIGRATION_STATUS["$legacy_feature"]="pending"
    done
}

#
# Legacy Feature Integration Functions
#

# Install feature using unified plugin/legacy system
install_feature_unified() {
    local feature_name="$1"
    local config_file="${2:-}"
    local force_plugin="${3:-auto}"  # auto, plugin, legacy
    
    log_info "Installing feature via unified system: $feature_name"
    
    # Check if we have a plugin mapping for this feature
    local plugin_id="${LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP[$feature_name]:-}"
    
    case "$force_plugin" in
        "plugin")
            if [[ -n "$plugin_id" ]]; then
                return _install_via_plugin_system "$plugin_id" "$config_file"
            else
                log_error "No plugin mapping available for: $feature_name"
                return 1
            fi
            ;;
        "legacy")
            return _install_via_legacy_system "$feature_name" "$config_file"
            ;;
        "auto"|*)
            # Auto-selection logic
            if [[ -n "$plugin_id" ]] && _is_plugin_available "$plugin_id"; then
                log_info "Using plugin system for: $feature_name -> $plugin_id"
                return _install_via_plugin_system "$plugin_id" "$config_file"
            else
                log_info "Falling back to legacy system for: $feature_name"
                return _install_via_legacy_system "$feature_name" "$config_file"
            fi
            ;;
    esac
}

# Execute feature using unified plugin/legacy system
execute_feature_unified() {
    local feature_name="$1"
    shift
    local args=("$@")
    
    log_info "Executing feature via unified system: $feature_name"
    
    # Check if feature is managed by plugin system
    local plugin_id="${LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP[$feature_name]:-}"
    
    if [[ -n "$plugin_id" ]] && _is_plugin_installed "$plugin_id"; then
        log_info "Executing via plugin system: $plugin_id"
        return plugin_system_execute_plugin "$plugin_id" "${args[@]}"
    else
        log_info "Executing via legacy system: $feature_name"
        return _execute_via_legacy_system "$feature_name" "${args[@]}"
    fi
}

# Get feature status using unified system
get_feature_status_unified() {
    local feature_name="$1"
    local format="${2:-text}"
    
    local plugin_id="${LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP[$feature_name]:-}"
    
    if [[ -n "$plugin_id" ]] && _is_plugin_installed "$plugin_id"; then
        # Get status from plugin system
        local plugin_status
        plugin_status=$(plugin_info "$plugin_id" "$format" 2>/dev/null)
        
        case "$format" in
            "json")
                echo "$plugin_status" | jq --arg feature "$feature_name" '. + {"legacy_feature": $feature, "management_system": "plugin"}'
                ;;
            *)
                echo "Feature: $feature_name (Plugin: $plugin_id)"
                echo "$plugin_status"
                ;;
        esac
    else
        # Get status from legacy system
        case "$format" in
            "json")
                echo "{\"feature\": \"$feature_name\", \"management_system\": \"legacy\", \"status\": \"$(_get_legacy_feature_status "$feature_name")\"}"
                ;;
            *)
                echo "Feature: $feature_name (Legacy System)"
                echo "Status: $(_get_legacy_feature_status "$feature_name")"
                ;;
        esac
    fi
}

# Migrate feature from legacy to plugin system
migrate_feature_to_plugin() {
    local feature_name="$1"
    local preserve_config="${2:-true}"
    
    log_info "Migrating feature to plugin system: $feature_name"
    
    local plugin_id="${LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP[$feature_name]:-}"
    if [[ -z "$plugin_id" ]]; then
        log_error "No plugin mapping available for migration: $feature_name"
        return 1
    fi
    
    if [[ "${MIGRATION_STATUS[$feature_name]:-}" == "completed" ]]; then
        log_warn "Feature already migrated: $feature_name"
        return 0
    fi
    
    MIGRATION_STATUS["$feature_name"]="in_progress"
    
    # Stop legacy feature if running
    _stop_legacy_feature "$feature_name"
    
    # Backup legacy configuration if requested
    local config_backup=""
    if [[ "$preserve_config" == "true" ]]; then
        config_backup=$(_backup_legacy_configuration "$feature_name")
    fi
    
    # Install plugin
    if plugin_system_install_plugin "$plugin_id" "$config_backup"; then
        # Mark migration as completed
        MIGRATION_STATUS["$feature_name"]="completed"
        _record_migration_success "$feature_name" "$plugin_id"
        log_info "Feature migration completed: $feature_name -> $plugin_id"
        return 0
    else
        # Migration failed
        MIGRATION_STATUS["$feature_name"]="failed"
        _record_migration_failure "$feature_name" "$plugin_id"
        log_error "Feature migration failed: $feature_name -> $plugin_id"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Migrate all features to plugin system
migrate_all_features_to_plugins() {
    local preserve_configs="${1:-true}"
    local parallel_migration="${2:-false}"
    local max_parallel="${3:-3}"
    
    log_info "Starting migration of all features to plugin system"
    
    local total_features=${#LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP[@]}
    local successful_migrations=0
    local failed_migrations=0
    
    if [[ "$parallel_migration" == "true" ]]; then
        local active_jobs=0
        
        for feature_name in "${!LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP[@]}"; do
            # Wait for available job slot
            while [[ $active_jobs -ge $max_parallel ]]; do
                wait -n
                ((active_jobs--))
            done
            
            # Start migration in background
            (migrate_feature_to_plugin "$feature_name" "$preserve_configs") &
            ((active_jobs++))
        done
        
        # Wait for all migrations to complete
        while [[ $active_jobs -gt 0 ]]; do
            wait -n
            ((active_jobs--))
        done
    else
        # Sequential migration
        for feature_name in "${!LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP[@]}"; do
            if migrate_feature_to_plugin "$feature_name" "$preserve_configs"; then
                ((successful_migrations++))
            else
                ((failed_migrations++))
            fi
        done
    fi
    
    # Count final results for parallel mode
    if [[ "$parallel_migration" == "true" ]]; then
        for feature_name in "${!MIGRATION_STATUS[@]}"; do
            case "${MIGRATION_STATUS[$feature_name]}" in
                "completed") ((successful_migrations++)) ;;
                "failed") ((failed_migrations++)) ;;
            esac
        done
    fi
    
    _generate_migration_report "$total_features" "$successful_migrations" "$failed_migrations"
    
    log_info "Migration completed: $successful_migrations/$total_features features migrated successfully"
    return $(( failed_migrations > 0 ? 1 : 0 ))
}

#
# TUI Integration Functions
#

# Enhanced TUI integration for unified feature management
integrate_with_tui() {
    log_info "Setting up TUI integration for unified plugin/legacy system"
    
    # Create TUI integration script
    local tui_integration_script="$ZFSLCD_BASE_DIR/ui/tui/lib/plugin-integration.sh"
    
    cat > "$tui_integration_script" << 'TUI_INTEGRATION_EOF'
#!/bin/bash
# TUI Plugin Integration Helper Functions

# Get unified feature list for TUI display
get_unified_feature_list() {
    local format="${1:-array}"
    local features=()
    
    # Add plugin-managed features
    for plugin_id in "${!PLUGIN_REGISTRY[@]}"; do
        local feature_name="${PLUGIN_TO_LEGACY_MAP[$plugin_id]:-$plugin_id}"
        features+=("$feature_name:plugin:$plugin_id")
    done
    
    # Add legacy-only features
    for legacy_feature in hardware-stress-suite hypervisor-config milspec-security; do
        if [[ -z "${LEGACY_TO_PLUGIN_MAP[$legacy_feature]:-}" ]]; then
            features+=("$legacy_feature:legacy:")
        fi
    done
    
    case "$format" in
        "json")
            printf '%s\n' "${features[@]}" | jq -R 'split(":") | {"name": .[0], "system": .[1], "plugin_id": .[2]}'
            ;;
        "array"|*)
            printf '%s\n' "${features[@]}"
            ;;
    esac
}

# Check if feature is available in unified system
is_feature_available_unified() {
    local feature_name="$1"

#!/bin/bash
#
# Add HAP Mode Boot Option for Intel ME Management
# Adds GRUB menu entry and tools for enabling HAP mode
#

set -euo pipefail

log_info() {
    echo "[INFO] $*"
}

log_warn() {
    echo "[WARN] $*"
}

log_error() {
    echo "[ERROR] $*"
}

# Main function to add HAP mode boot option
add_hap_mode_boot_option() {
    log_info "Adding HAP mode boot option to LiveCD"
    
    # Install efitools
    log_info "Installing efitools..."
    apt-get update >/dev/null 2>&1
    apt-get install -y efitools wget
    
    # Create tools directory
    mkdir -p /boot/efi/EFI/tools
    
    # Download setup_var tool
    log_info "Downloading setup_var.efi tool..."
    wget -q https://github.com/datasone/setup_var.efi/releases/download/v0.3/setup_var.efi -O /tmp/setup_var.efi
    cp /tmp/setup_var.efi /boot/efi/EFI/tools/
    
    # Create HAP mode script
    cat > /boot/efi/EFI/tools/enable_hap.nsh << 'NSH_EOF'
@echo -off
echo "Intel ME HAP Mode Enabler"
echo "========================="
echo ""
echo "Attempting common HAP mode offsets..."
echo ""

echo "Trying offset 0x16F (most common)..."
setup_var 0x16F 0x01
if %lasterror% == 0 goto success

echo "Trying offset 0x2B0 (alternative)..."
setup_var 0x2B0 0x01
if %lasterror% == 0 goto success

echo "Trying offset 0x658 (Dell variant)..."
setup_var 0x658 0x01
if %lasterror% == 0 goto success

echo "Trying offset 0x943 (newer platforms)..."
setup_var 0x943 0x01
if %lasterror% == 0 goto success

:error
echo ""
echo "ERROR: Could not enable HAP mode with standard offsets"
echo "Please check your platform documentation for the correct offset"
goto end

:success
echo ""
echo "SUCCESS: HAP mode enabled!"
echo "System will reboot in 5 seconds..."
stall 5000000
reset

:end
echo ""
echo "Press any key to return to shell..."
pause
NSH_EOF

    # Add GRUB menu entry
    log_info "Adding GRUB menu entry for HAP mode tools..."
    cat >> /etc/grub.d/40_custom << 'GRUB_EOF'

menuentry 'Intel ME HAP Mode Tools' --class efi {
    insmod fat
    insmod chain
    search --no-floppy --fs-uuid --set=root $efi_uuid
    echo 'Loading Intel ME HAP Mode Tools...'
    echo 'Use setup_var commands to enable HAP mode:'
    echo '  setup_var 0x16F 0x01  # Most common offset'
    echo '  setup_var 0x2B0 0x01  # Alternative offset'  
    echo '  setup_var 0x658 0x01  # Dell variant'
    echo '  setup_var 0x943 0x01  # Newer platforms'
    echo ''
    echo 'Or run: fs0:\EFI\tools\enable_hap.nsh'
    chainloader /EFI/tools/setup_var.efi
}

# ZFS Boot Menu Integration Script
# Downloads, builds, and integrates ZFS Boot Menu into the LiveCD

log_info "Installing ZFS and build dependencies..."

cat > "$CHROOT_DIR/tmp/install-zfs-deps.sh" << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive

# Update package list
apt-get update

# Install ZFS packages
apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    zfsutils-linux \
    zfs-initramfs \
    zfs-dkms

# Install build dependencies for ZBM
apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    build-essential \
    git \
    wget \
    curl \
    perl \
    libconfig-yaml-perl \
    libsort-versions-perl \
    libyaml-pp-perl \
    libboolean-perl \
    yq \
    fzf \
    kexec-tools \
    mbuffer \
    gummiboot \
    efibootmgr

# Install optional dependencies
apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    void-linux-kernel-headers \
    dracut \
    dracut-core

echo "✓ ZFS dependencies installed"
EOF

chroot "$CHROOT_DIR" bash /tmp/install-zfs-deps.sh
rm -f "$CHROOT_DIR/tmp/install-zfs-deps.sh"

# ===== 2. DOWNLOAD AND BUILD ZFS BOOT MENU =====
log_info "Downloading ZFS Boot Menu source..."

cat > "$CHROOT_DIR/tmp/build-zbm.sh" << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

# Create build directory
mkdir -p /opt/zfs-bootmenu
cd /opt/zfs-bootmenu

# Clone ZFS Boot Menu
if [ ! -d "zfsbootmenu" ]; then
    git clone https://github.com/zbm-dev/zfsbootmenu.git
fi

cd zfsbootmenu

# Get latest stable release
LATEST_TAG=$(git describe --tags --abbrev=0)
echo "Building ZFS Boot Menu $LATEST_TAG"
git checkout "$LATEST_TAG"

# Build ZBM components
echo "Building ZFS Boot Menu components..."

# Build dracut module
make dracut

# Build UEFI executable
make uefi

# Build kernel/initramfs
make kernel

echo "✓ ZFS Boot Menu built successfully"

# Install ZBM components
make install

echo "✓ ZFS Boot Menu installed"
EOF

chroot "$CHROOT_DIR" bash /tmp/build-zbm.sh
rm -f "$CHROOT_DIR/tmp/build-zbm.sh"

# ===== 3. CREATE ZBM CONFIGURATION =====
log_info "Creating ZFS Boot Menu configuration..."

cat > "$CHROOT_DIR/etc/zfsbootmenu/config.yaml" << 'EOF'
Global:
  ManageImages: true
  BootMountPoint: /boot/efi
  DracutConfDir: /etc/zfsbootmenu/dracut.conf.d
  PreHooksDir: /etc/zfsbootmenu/hooks.d
  PostHooksDir: /etc/zfsbootmenu/hooks.d
  InitCPIOConfig: /etc/zfsbootmenu/mkinitcpio.conf
  
Components:
  Enabled: true
  ImageDir: /boot/efi/EFI/zbm
  Versions: 3
  Kernel: /boot/vmlinuz
  Initramfs: /boot/initramfs-zbm.img
  CommandLine: ro quiet loglevel=0 zbm.prefer=zroot

EFI:
  ImageDir: /boot/efi/EFI/zbm
  Versions: 3
  Enabled: true
  
UEFI:
  Enabled: true
  Executable: /boot/efi/EFI/zbm/vmlinuz.efi
  CommandLine: ro quiet loglevel=0 zbm.prefer=zroot zbm.import_delay=5

syslinux:
  Enabled: false
  
Kernel:
  CommandLine: ro quiet loglevel=0 zbm.prefer=zroot zbm.timeout=30
  Prefix: vmlinuz
  Version: "%{version}"
  
zfsbootmenu:
  timeout: 30
  default_selection: zroot
  sort_keys: 
    - name
    - creation
EOF

# Create dracut config for ZBM
mkdir -p "$CHROOT_DIR/etc/zfsbootmenu/dracut.conf.d"

cat > "$CHROOT_DIR/etc/zfsbootmenu/dracut.conf.d/zfsbootmenu.conf" << 'EOF'
# ZFS Boot Menu dracut configuration

# Essential modules
add_dracutmodules+=" zfs bash dracut-systemd kernel-modules base "
omit_dracutmodules+=" btrfs network ifcfg "

# Force drivers
add_drivers+=" zfs ahci nvme "

# Include essential binaries
install_items+=" /sbin/zfs /sbin/zpool /sbin/mount.zfs "

# Compression
compress="xz"
show_modules=yes
EOF

# ===== 4. CREATE ZBM INTEGRATION SCRIPTS =====
log_info "Creating ZFS Boot Menu integration scripts..."

cat > "$CHROOT_DIR/usr/local/bin/generate-zbm" << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
#
# Generate ZFS Boot Menu Images
#

set -euo pipefail

log_info() {
    echo "[INFO] $*"
}

log_error() {
    echo "[ERROR] $*"
}

log_info "Generating ZFS Boot Menu images..."

# Ensure EFI directory exists
mkdir -p /boot/efi/EFI/zbm

# Generate bootloader images
if command -v generate-zbm >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    log_info "Using installed generate-zbm command..."
    /usr/local/bin/generate-zbm --config /etc/zfsbootmenu/config.yaml
elif [ -x /opt/zfs-bootmenu/zfsbootmenu/bin/generate-zbm ]; then
    log_info "Using local build..."
    /opt/zfs-bootmenu/zfsbootmenu/bin/generate-zbm --config /etc/zfsbootmenu/config.yaml
else
    log_error "ZFS Boot Menu not found!"
    exit 1
fi

# Update EFI boot entries
if command -v efibootmgr >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    log_info "Creating EFI boot entry for ZFS Boot Menu..."
    
    # Find EFI partition
    EFI_PART=$(findmnt -n -o SOURCE /boot/efi 2>/dev/null || echo "")
    
    if [ -n "$EFI_PART" ]; then
        # Create boot entry for ZBM
        efibootmgr --create --disk "${EFI_PART%[0-9]*}" --part "${EFI_PART##*[^0-9]}" \
                   --loader '\EFI\zbm\vmlinuz.efi' --label "ZFS Boot Menu" \
                   --unicode 'ro quiet loglevel=0 zbm.prefer=zroot' || true
    fi
fi

log_info "ZFS Boot Menu generation complete"
EOF
chmod +x "$CHROOT_DIR/usr/local/bin/generate-zbm"

# Create ZBM update script
cat > "$CHROOT_DIR/usr/local/bin/update-zbm" << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
#
# Update ZFS Boot Menu after kernel changes
#

set -euo pipefail

echo "Updating ZFS Boot Menu..."

# Regenerate initramfs
if command -v update-initramfs >/dev/null 2>&1; then

fi

# Regenerate ZBM images

fi

EOF

}

menuentry 'ZFS Boot Menu (Direct)' --class linux {
    insmod zfs
    insmod part_gpt
    insmod fat
    search --no-floppy --fs-uuid --set=root $efi_uuid
    echo 'Loading ZFS Boot Menu (Direct Boot)...'

#!/bin/bash
#
# Setup ZFS Root Pool for Boot Menu
#

set -euo pipefail

POOL_NAME="${1:-zroot}"

if [ -z "$DEVICE" ]; then
    echo "Usage: $0 <pool_name> <device>"
    echo "Example: $0 zroot /dev/nvme0n1p3"
    exit 1
fi

echo "Setting up ZFS root pool: $POOL_NAME on $DEVICE"

# Create ZFS pool
zpool create -f \
    -o ashift=12 \
    -o autotrim=on \
    -O acltype=posixacl \
    -O compression=lz4 \
    -O dnodesize=auto \
    -O normalization=formD \
    -O relatime=on \
    -O xattr=sa \
    -O mountpoint=/ \
    "$POOL_NAME" "$DEVICE"

# Create datasets
zfs create -o canmount=off "$POOL_NAME/ROOT"
zfs create -o mountpoint=/ "$POOL_NAME/ROOT/ubuntu"

# Set bootfs

echo "ZFS root pool '$POOL_NAME' created successfully"

EOF

# ZFS BOOT MENU INTEGRATION
## Advanced Boot Management for ZFS Systems

---

## 🚀 WHAT IS ZFS BOOT MENU?

ZFS Boot Menu (ZBM) is an advanced bootloader that provides:
- **Native ZFS support** - Boot directly from ZFS pools
- **Snapshot booting** - Boot from any ZFS snapshot
- **Multiple kernels** - Choose between different kernel versions
- **Recovery options** - Built-in rescue and repair tools
- **Zero configuration** - Automatically detects ZFS pools and datasets

---

## QUICK START COMMANDS

### Generate Boot Menu
```bash
# Generate ZFS Boot Menu images
sudo generate-zbm

# Update after kernel changes
sudo update-zbm
```

### Setup ZFS Root Pool
```bash
# Create ZFS root pool (DESTRUCTIVE!)
sudo setup-zfs-root zroot /dev/nvme0n1p3

# Verify pool
zpool status zroot
```

---

## BOOT MENU FEATURES

### 1. **Snapshot Booting**
- Boot from any ZFS snapshot
- Perfect for system recovery
- Test changes safely

### 2. **Multi-Kernel Support**
- Choose between kernel versions
- Automatic fallback on boot failure
- Keep multiple kernels available

### 3. **Recovery Tools**
- Built-in ZFS tools
- File system repair
- Emergency shell access

### 4. **Live Environment**
- Full system access during boot
- Change configurations
- Repair file systems

---

## CONFIGURATION

### Main Config: `/etc/zfsbootmenu/config.yaml`

```yaml
Global:
  ManageImages: true
  BootMountPoint: /boot/efi
  
Components:
  Enabled: true
  ImageDir: /boot/efi/EFI/zbm
  Versions: 3
  
UEFI:
  Enabled: true
  Executable: /boot/efi/EFI/zbm/vmlinuz.efi
  CommandLine: ro quiet loglevel=0 zbm.prefer=zroot
```

### Dracut Config: `/etc/zfsbootmenu/dracut.conf.d/zfsbootmenu.conf`

```bash
add_dracutmodules+=" zfs bash dracut-systemd "
omit_dracutmodules+=" btrfs network "
add_drivers+=" zfs ahci nvme "
compress="xz"
```

---

## USAGE SCENARIOS

### 1. **System Updates**
```bash
# Before updating
sudo zfs snapshot zroot/ROOT/ubuntu@pre-update

# After successful update
sudo zfs destroy zroot/ROOT/ubuntu@pre-update

# If update failed, boot from snapshot via ZBM
```

### 2. **Kernel Testing**
```bash
# Install new kernel
sudo apt install linux-image-6.5.0-test

# Update ZBM
sudo update-zbm

# Reboot and choose kernel in ZBM menu
```

#!/bin/bash

# Network Boot Server for ZFS LiveCD
# Comprehensive PXE/iPXE/FOG/Clonezilla boot server setup

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
MAGENTA='\033[0;35m'
BOLD='\033[1m'
NC='\033[0m'

# Configuration
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
CONFIG_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/pxe-boot-configs"
TFTP_ROOT="/srv/tftp"
HTTP_ROOT="/srv/http"
NFS_ROOT="/srv/nfs"
FOG_ROOT="/srv/fog"
LOG_DIR="/var/log/network-boot"
DNSMASQ_CONF="/etc/dnsmasq.d/pxe-boot.conf"
DHCP_RANGE_START="192.168.1.100"
DHCP_RANGE_END="192.168.1.200"
DHCP_LEASE_TIME="12h"
DOMAIN_NAME="pxe.local"

# Service status tracking
declare -A SERVICE_STATUS

# Display banner
show_banner() {
    clear
    echo -e "${BLUE}╔══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗${NC}"
    echo -e "${BLUE}║${NC}${BOLD}                        Network Boot Server for ZFS LiveCD                   ${NC}${BLUE}║${NC}"
    echo -e "${BLUE}║${NC}${BOLD}         Comprehensive PXE/iPXE/FOG/Clonezilla Infrastructure Setup         ${NC}${BLUE}║${NC}"
    echo -e "${BLUE}╚══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝${NC}"
    echo
}

# Logging function
log() {
    local level="$1"
    shift
    local message="$*"
    local timestamp=$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')
    echo -e "[${timestamp}] [${level}] ${message}" | tee -a "$LOG_DIR/network-boot.log"
}

# Check if running as root
check_root() {
    if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then
        echo -e "${RED}This script must be run as root${NC}"
        echo "Please run: sudo $0"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Detect network interface
detect_network_interface() {
    local interfaces=($(ip route | grep default | awk '{print $5}' | head -1))
    
    if [[ ${#interfaces[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
        log "ERROR" "No active network interface found"
        return 1
    fi
    
    NETWORK_INTERFACE="${interfaces[0]}"
    SERVER_IP=$(ip addr show "$NETWORK_INTERFACE" | grep -oP 'inet \K[\d.]+' | head -1)
    NETWORK=$(ip route | grep "$NETWORK_INTERFACE" | grep -E '192\.168|10\.|172\.' | head -1 | awk '{print $1}')
    
    log "INFO" "Detected network interface: $NETWORK_INTERFACE"
    log "INFO" "Server IP: $SERVER_IP"
    log "INFO" "Network: $NETWORK"
    
    return 0
}

# Create directory structure
setup_directories() {
    log "INFO" "Creating directory structure"
    
    local directories=(
        "$TFTP_ROOT"
        "$TFTP_ROOT/pxelinux.cfg"
        "$TFTP_ROOT/ipxe"

#
# Deploy Ring -1 ISO to Multiple Servers
# Mass deployment system for pushing LiveCD to entire server fleet
#

set -euo pipefail

RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
PURPLE='\033[0;35m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
WHITE='\033[1;37m'
NC='\033[0m'

# Configuration
ISO_PATH="${1:-/dev/shm/ring-minus-one.iso}"
DEPLOYMENT_MODE="${2:-pxe}"  # pxe, ipmi, wake-on-lan, ssh
SERVERS_FILE="${3:-/etc/deployment/servers.txt}"
TFTP_ROOT="/srv/tftp"
HTTP_ROOT="/srv/http"
LOG_DIR="/var/log/iso-deployment"

echo -e "${PURPLE}╔══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗${NC}"
echo -e "${PURPLE}║           RING -1 ISO MASS DEPLOYMENT SYSTEM                  ║${NC}"
echo -e "${PURPLE}╚══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝${NC}"
echo ""

log_info() {
    echo -e "${CYAN}[INFO]${NC} $*"
    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] [INFO] $*" >> "$LOG_DIR/deployment.log"
}

log_success() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}[SUCCESS]${NC} $*"
    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] [SUCCESS] $*" >> "$LOG_DIR/deployment.log"
}

log_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $*"
    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] [ERROR] $*" >> "$LOG_DIR/deployment.log"
}

log_warn() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $*"
    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] [WARN] $*" >> "$LOG_DIR/deployment.log"
}

# Check if running as root
if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then
    echo -e "${RED}This script must be run as root${NC}"
    echo "Usage: sudo $0 [iso_path] [deployment_mode] [servers_file]"
    exit 1
fi

# Create log directory
mkdir -p "$LOG_DIR"

# ===== 1. VALIDATE ISO AND SETUP =====
log_info "Validating Ring -1 ISO..."

if [[ ! -f "$ISO_PATH" ]]; then
    log_error "ISO not found: $ISO_PATH"
    log_info "Please specify the correct path to Ring -1 ISO"
    exit 1
fi

ISO_SIZE=$(du -h "$ISO_PATH" | cut -f1)
ISO_MD5=$(md5sum "$ISO_PATH" | cut -d' ' -f1)

log_success "Found Ring -1 ISO: $ISO_PATH ($ISO_SIZE)"
log_info "ISO MD5: $ISO_MD5"

# ===== 2. SETUP NETWORK BOOT INFRASTRUCTURE =====
log_info "Setting up network boot infrastructure..."

# Install required packages
apt-get update >/dev/null 2>&1
apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    dnsmasq \
    tftpd-hpa \
    apache2 \
    nfs-kernel-server \
    syslinux \
    syslinux-efi \
    pxelinux \
    ipxe-qemu \
    wakeonlan \
    ipmitool \
    parallel \
    rsync \
    wget \
    curl

# Create directory structure
mkdir -p "$TFTP_ROOT"/{pxelinux.cfg,uefi,ipxe,ring-minus-one}
mkdir -p "$HTTP_ROOT"/{iso,images,drivers}
mkdir -p /srv/nfs/livecd

# Copy bootloaders
cp /usr/lib/PXELINUX/pxelinux.0 "$TFTP_ROOT/"
cp /usr/lib/syslinux/modules/bios/*.c32 "$TFTP_ROOT/"
cp /usr/lib/syslinux/modules/efi64/* "$TFTP_ROOT/uefi/"

# Copy ISO to HTTP root
log_info "Copying ISO to HTTP root..."
cp "$ISO_PATH" "$HTTP_ROOT/iso/ring-minus-one.iso"

# Extract kernel and initrd from ISO
log_info "Extracting kernel and initrd from ISO..."
MOUNT_POINT="/mnt/iso-extract"
mkdir -p "$MOUNT_POINT"
mount -o loop "$ISO_PATH" "$MOUNT_POINT"

# Copy kernel and initrd
cp "$MOUNT_POINT/casper/vmlinuz" "$TFTP_ROOT/ring-minus-one/"
cp "$MOUNT_POINT/casper/initrd" "$TFTP_ROOT/ring-minus-one/"

# Copy for NFS
cp -r "$MOUNT_POINT"/* /srv/nfs/livecd/

umount "$MOUNT_POINT"
rmdir "$MOUNT_POINT"

# ===== 3. CONFIGURE DNSMASQ FOR PXE BOOT =====
log_info "Configuring DNSMASQ for PXE boot..."

cat > /etc/dnsmasq.d/ring-minus-one-pxe.conf << 'EOF'
# Ring -1 PXE Boot Configuration

# Enable DHCP
dhcp-range=192.168.1.100,192.168.1.200,255.255.255.0,12h

# PXE Boot options
dhcp-boot=pxelinux.0

# TFTP settings
enable-tftp
tftp-root=/srv/tftp

# DNS settings
domain=ring-minus-one.local
local=/ring-minus-one.local/

# DHCP options
dhcp-option=option:router,192.168.1.1
dhcp-option=option:dns-server,192.168.1.1,8.8.8.8
dhcp-option=option:domain-name,"ring-minus-one.local"

# Logging
log-dhcp
log-queries
EOF

# ===== 4. CREATE PXE MENU =====
log_info "Creating PXE menu configuration..."

cat > "$TFTP_ROOT/pxelinux.cfg/default" << 'EOF'
DEFAULT menu.c32
PROMPT 0
TIMEOUT 100
ONTIMEOUT ring-minus-one-auto

MENU TITLE Ring -1 LiveCD Network Deployment
MENU BACKGROUND splash.png
MENU COLOR border 30;44 #40ffffff #a0000000 std
MENU COLOR title 1;36;44 #9033ccff #a0000000 std
MENU COLOR sel 7;37;40 #e0ffffff #20ff8000 all
MENU COLOR hotsel 1;5;37;40 #e0ffffff #20ff8000 all
MENU COLOR item 37;40 #80ffffff #00000000 std
MENU COLOR hotkey 1;37;40 #ffffffff #00000000 std

LABEL ring-minus-one-auto
    MENU LABEL Ring -1 LiveCD (Auto Deploy)
    MENU DEFAULT
    KERNEL ring-minus-one/vmlinuz
    APPEND initrd=ring-minus-one/initrd boot=casper netboot=nfs nfsroot=192.168.1.1:/srv/nfs/livecd ip=dhcp quiet splash --

LABEL ring-minus-one-manual
    MENU LABEL Ring -1 LiveCD (Manual Install)
    KERNEL ring-minus-one/vmlinuz
    APPEND initrd=ring-minus-one/initrd boot=casper netboot=nfs nfsroot=192.168.1.1:/srv/nfs/livecd ip=dhcp

LABEL ring-minus-one-http
    MENU LABEL Ring -1 LiveCD (HTTP Boot)
    KERNEL ring-minus-one/vmlinuz
    APPEND initrd=ring-minus-one/initrd boot=casper netboot=url url=http://192.168.1.1/iso/ring-minus-one.iso ip=dhcp

LABEL ring-minus-one-rescue
    MENU LABEL Ring -1 LiveCD (Rescue Mode)
    KERNEL ring-minus-one/vmlinuz
    APPEND initrd=ring-minus-one/initrd boot=casper netboot=nfs nfsroot=192.168.1.1:/srv/nfs/livecd ip=dhcp single

LABEL local-boot
    MENU LABEL Boot from Local Disk
    LOCALBOOT 0

LABEL reboot
    MENU LABEL Reboot System
    COM32 reboot.c32

LABEL poweroff
    MENU LABEL Power Off System
    COM32 poweroff.c32
EOF

# ===== 5. CONFIGURE APACHE FOR HTTP BOOT =====
log_info "Configuring Apache for HTTP boot..."

cat > /etc/apache2/sites-available/ring-minus-one-deployment.conf << 'EOF'
<VirtualHost *:80>
    ServerName ring-minus-one-deployment
    DocumentRoot /srv/http
    
    <Directory /srv/http>
        Options Indexes FollowSymLinks
        AllowOverride None
        Require all granted
    </Directory>
    
    # Enable downloads with resume support
    <Directory /srv/http/iso>
        Header set Accept-Ranges bytes
    </Directory>
    
    # Logging
    LogLevel info
    ErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/ring-minus-one-error.log
    CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/ring-minus-one-access.log combined
</VirtualHost>
EOF

a2ensite ring-minus-one-deployment.conf
a2enmod headers
systemctl reload apache2

# ===== 6. CONFIGURE NFS FOR NETWORK BOOT =====
log_info "Configuring NFS for network boot..."

cat >> /etc/exports << 'EOF'
/srv/nfs/livecd *(ro,sync,no_wdelay,insecure_locks,no_root_squash,insecure,no_subtree_check)
EOF

exportfs -a

# ===== 7. CREATE SERVER DEPLOYMENT FUNCTIONS =====
log_info "Creating server deployment functions..."

# Function to deploy via Wake-on-LAN
deploy_via_wol() {
    local server_mac="$1"
    local server_ip="$2"
    local server_name="$3"
    
    log_info "Deploying to $server_name ($server_ip) via Wake-on-LAN..."
    
    # Send WoL packet
    wakeonlan "$server_mac"
    
    # Wait for system to boot and PXE
    sleep 10
    
    # Check if system is responding
    if ping -c 1 -W 5 "$server_ip" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        log_success "Server $server_name is responding"
        return 0
    else
        log_warn "Server $server_name not responding after WoL"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Function to deploy via IPMI
deploy_via_ipmi() {
    local ipmi_ip="$1"
    local ipmi_user="$2"

#!/bin/bash
#
# Ring -1 LiveCD Builder - RAM-Based Edition with Full livecd-gen Integration
# Builds entire system in tmpfs to minimize disk usage
# Includes IOMMU workarounds and virtio fallbacks
# Integrates all livecd-gen tools and features
#

set -e

# Color codes for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m'

# Configuration
WORK_DIR="/dev/shm/ring-minus-one-build"
OUTPUT_DIR="$(pwd)/output"
ISO_NAME="ring-minus-one-ram-$(date +%Y%m%d).iso"
TMPFS_SIZE="20G"  # Increased for KDE + kernel toolchain + all livecd-gen tools
MIN_RAM_GB=8
MIN_DISK_GB=2
MAX_PARALLEL_JOBS=4
OPERATION_TIMEOUT=300  # 5 minutes timeout for operations
MEMORY_THRESHOLD_KB=$((2 * 1024 * 1024))  # 2GB minimum free memory
BUILD_START_TIME=$(date +%s)

# livecd-gen paths
LIVECD_GEN_DIR="$(dirname "$(readlink -f "$0")")"
LIB_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/lib"
SRC_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/src"
SCRIPTS_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/scripts"
CONFIG_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/config"
PLUGINS_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/plugins"
SECURITY_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/security-research-toolkit"
HARDWARE_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/hardware-profiles"

# Source common library if available
if [ -f "${LIB_DIR}/common.sh" ]; then
    source "${LIB_DIR}/common.sh"
fi

# System checks
check_requirements() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Checking system requirements...${NC}"
    
    # Check RAM
    total_ram=$(free -g | awk '/^Mem:/{print $2}')
    if [ "$total_ram" -lt "$MIN_RAM_GB" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Insufficient RAM: ${total_ram}GB available, ${MIN_RAM_GB}GB required${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] RAM check passed: ${total_ram}GB available${NC}"
    
    # Check disk space (only for final ISO)
    available_disk=$(df -BG . | awk 'NR==2 {print $4}' | sed 's/G//')
    if [ "$available_disk" -lt "$MIN_DISK_GB" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Insufficient disk space: ${available_disk}GB available, ${MIN_DISK_GB}GB required${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Disk check passed: ${available_disk}GB available${NC}"
    
    # Check for required tools with error handling
    for tool in debootstrap squashfs-tools xorriso isolinux syslinux-utils syslinux-common; do
        if ! command -v $tool &> /dev/null && ! dpkg -l | grep -q "^ii.*$tool"; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Installing $tool...${NC}"
            local retries=3
            while [ $retries -gt 0 ]; do
                if apt-get update && apt-get install -y $tool; then
                    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Successfully installed $tool${NC}"
                    break
                fi
                ((retries--))
                if [ $retries -gt 0 ]; then
                    echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Installation failed, retrying... ($retries attempts left)${NC}"
                    sleep 2
                else
                    echo -e "${RED}[!] Failed to install required tool: $tool${NC}"
                    exit 1
                fi
            done
        fi
    done
    
    # Validate tmpfs size against available RAM
    local tmpfs_size_gb=$(echo "$TMPFS_SIZE" | sed 's/G//')
    if [ "$tmpfs_size_gb" -gt "$total_ram" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Requested tmpfs size (${tmpfs_size_gb}GB) exceeds available RAM (${total_ram}GB)${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Adjusting tmpfs size to ${total_ram}GB${NC}"
        TMPFS_SIZE="${total_ram}G"
    fi
    
    # Ensure essential boot components are available
    if [ ! -f "/usr/lib/ISOLINUX/isolinux.bin" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] isolinux.bin not found - installing isolinux${NC}"
        apt-get install -y isolinux
    fi

toolUseResult.originalFile:
#!/bin/bash
#
# Ring -1 LiveCD Builder - RAM-Based Edition with Full livecd-gen Integration
# Builds entire system in tmpfs to minimize disk usage
# Includes IOMMU workarounds and virtio fallbacks
# Integrates all livecd-gen tools and features
#

set -e

# Color codes for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m'

# Configuration
WORK_DIR="/dev/shm/ring-minus-one-build"
OUTPUT_DIR="$(pwd)/output"
ISO_NAME="ring-minus-one-ram-$(date +%Y%m%d).iso"
TMPFS_SIZE="20G"  # Increased for KDE + kernel toolchain + all livecd-gen tools
MIN_RAM_GB=8
MIN_DISK_GB=2
MAX_PARALLEL_JOBS=4
OPERATION_TIMEOUT=300  # 5 minutes timeout for operations
MEMORY_THRESHOLD_KB=$((2 * 1024 * 1024))  # 2GB minimum free memory
BUILD_START_TIME=$(date +%s)

# livecd-gen paths
LIVECD_GEN_DIR="$(dirname "$(readlink -f "$0")")"
LIB_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/lib"
SRC_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/src"
SCRIPTS_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/scripts"
CONFIG_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/config"
PLUGINS_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/plugins"
SECURITY_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/security-research-toolkit"
HARDWARE_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/hardware-profiles"

# Source common library if available
if [ -f "${LIB_DIR}/common.sh" ]; then
    source "${LIB_DIR}/common.sh"
fi

# System checks
check_requirements() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Checking system requirements...${NC}"
    
    # Check RAM
    total_ram=$(free -g | awk '/^Mem:/{print $2}')
    if [ "$total_ram" -lt "$MIN_RAM_GB" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Insufficient RAM: ${total_ram}GB available, ${MIN_RAM_GB}GB required${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] RAM check passed: ${total_ram}GB available${NC}"
    
    # Check disk space (only for final ISO)
    available_disk=$(df -BG . | awk 'NR==2 {print $4}' | sed 's/G//')
    if [ "$available_disk" -lt "$MIN_DISK_GB" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Insufficient disk space: ${available_disk}GB available, ${MIN_DISK_GB}GB required${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Disk check passed: ${available_disk}GB available${NC}"
    
    # Check for required tools with error handling
    for tool in debootstrap squashfs-tools xorriso isolinux syslinux-utils syslinux-common; do
        if ! command -v $tool &> /dev/null && ! dpkg -l | grep -q "^ii.*$tool"; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Installing $tool...${NC}"
            local retries=3
            while [ $retries -gt 0 ]; do
                if apt-get update && apt-get install -y $tool; then
                    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Successfully installed $tool${NC}"
                    break
                fi
                ((retries--))
                if [ $retries -gt 0 ]; then
                    echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Installation failed, retrying... ($retries attempts left)${NC}"
                    sleep 2
                else
                    echo -e "${RED}[!] Failed to install required tool: $tool${NC}"
                    exit 1
                fi
            done
        fi
    done
    
    # Validate tmpfs size against available RAM
    local tmpfs_size_gb=$(echo "$TMPFS_SIZE" | sed 's/G//')
    if [ "$tmpfs_size_gb" -gt "$total_ram" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Requested tmpfs size (${tmpfs_size_gb}GB) exceeds available RAM (${total_ram}GB)${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Adjusting tmpfs size to ${total_ram}GB${NC}"
        TMPFS_SIZE="${total_ram}G"
    fi
    
    # Ensure essential boot components are available
    if [ ! -f "/usr/lib/ISOLINUX/isolinux.bin" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] isolinux.bin not found - installing isolinux${NC}"
        apt-get install -y isolinux
    fi
    
    # Check virtualization support (but don't fail if missing)
    if [ -e /dev/kvm ]; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] KVM support detected${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] No KVM support - will use software emulation fallback${NC}"
    fi
    
    # Check IOMMU (informational only)
    if dmesg | grep -q "IOMMU"; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] IOMMU detected (may not be enabled)${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] No IOMMU detected - using virtio fallbacks${NC}"
    fi
}

# Safe cleanup of existing mount
cleanup_mount() {
    local mount_point="$1"
    local retries=5
    
    while mountpoint -q "$mount_point" 2>/dev/null && [ $retries -gt 0 ]; do
        # Try graceful unmount first
        if umount "$mount_point" 2>/dev/null; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Successfully unmounted $mount_point${NC}"
            return 0
        fi
        
        # Check for processes using the mount
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Mount busy, checking processes...${NC}"
        lsof +D "$mount_point" 2>/dev/null || true
        
        # Kill processes if needed
        if [ $retries -eq 2 ]; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Attempting to kill processes using mount${NC}"
            fuser -km "$mount_point" 2>/dev/null || true
        fi
        
        sleep 2
        ((retries--))
    done
    
    if mountpoint -q "$mount_point" 2>/dev/null; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Failed to unmount $mount_point safely${NC}"
        return 1
    fi
    return 0
}

# Setup tmpfs workspace with proper error handling
setup_tmpfs() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Setting up tmpfs workspace...${NC}"
    
    # Clean up any existing mount safely
    if mountpoint -q "$WORK_DIR" 2>/dev/null; then
        if ! cleanup_mount "$WORK_DIR"; then
            echo -e "${RED}[!] Cannot proceed with busy mount point${NC}"
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
    
    # Create and mount tmpfs with error checking
    mkdir -p "$WORK_DIR"
    if ! mount -t tmpfs -o size="$TMPFS_SIZE" tmpfs "$WORK_DIR"; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Failed to mount tmpfs at $WORK_DIR${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Create directory structure
    mkdir -p "$WORK_DIR"/{chroot,iso/{boot/isolinux,live},tmp}
    mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$WORK_DIR"/logs
    
    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Tmpfs mounted: $(df -h $WORK_DIR | tail -1)${NC}"
}

# Monitor memory usage with exhaustion detection
monitor_memory() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Current memory usage:${NC}"
    free -h
    df -h "$WORK_DIR" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Check for memory exhaustion
    local available_kb=$(awk '/MemAvailable/ {print $2}' /proc/meminfo)
    if [ "$available_kb" -lt "$MEMORY_THRESHOLD_KB" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] WARNING: Low memory detected ($(( available_kb / 1024 ))MB available)${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Build may fail due to insufficient memory${NC}"
        
        # Try to free some memory
        sync
        echo 3 > /proc/sys/vm/drop_caches 2>/dev/null || true
        
        # Re-check after cleanup
        available_kb=$(awk '/MemAvailable/ {print $2}' /proc/meminfo)
        if [ "$available_kb" -lt "$((MEMORY_THRESHOLD_KB / 2))" ]; then
            echo -e "${RED}[!] CRITICAL: Memory too low to continue safely${NC}"
            return 1
        fi
    fi
    return 0
}

# Create minimal base system
create_base_system() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Creating minimal base system...${NC}"
    
    # Use minimal variant to save RAM (live-boot will be installed separately)
    # Include initramfs-tools to ensure we can generate initrd
    debootstrap --variant=minbase --arch=amd64 \
        --include=linux-image-generic,systemd-sysv,initramfs-tools,busybox-initramfs \
        jammy "$WORK_DIR/chroot" http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/
    
    # Setup apt sources for universe repository
    cat > "$WORK_DIR/chroot/etc/apt/sources.list" << EOF
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy main restricted universe multiverse
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-updates main restricted universe multiverse
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-security main restricted universe multiverse
EOF
    
    # Setup chroot bind mounts for proper functionality
    setup_chroot_mounts
    
    # Install live-boot and casper after base system is ready
    chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" apt-get update
    
    # Ensure initramfs-tools is installed before trying to use it
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Installing essential boot packages...${NC}"
    chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
        initramfs-tools \
        initramfs-tools-core \
        live-boot \
        live-boot-initramfs-tools \
        casper \
        syslinux-common \
        busybox-static \
        zstd
    
    # Get kernel version
    kernel_version=$(chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" ls /lib/modules/ | head -1)
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Generating initrd for kernel ${kernel_version}...${NC}"
    
    # Multiple methods to ensure initrd creation
    if [ -n "$kernel_version" ]; then
        # Method 1: Try update-initramfs
        if chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" which update-initramfs >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Using update-initramfs...${NC}"
            chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" update-initramfs -c -k "$kernel_version" || \
            chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" update-initramfs -u -k "$kernel_version" || \
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] update-initramfs failed${NC}"
        fi
        
        # Method 2: Try mkinitramfs directly
        if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" ]; then
            if chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" which mkinitramfs >/dev/null 2>&1; then
                echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Using mkinitramfs directly...${NC}"
                chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" mkinitramfs -o "/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" "$kernel_version" || \
                echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] mkinitramfs failed${NC}"
            fi
        fi
        
        # Method 3: Try dracut if available
        if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" ]; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Installing dracut as fallback...${NC}"
            chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends dracut-core 2>/dev/null && \
            chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" dracut --force "/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" "$kernel_version" 2>/dev/null || \
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] dracut failed or not available${NC}"
        fi
        
        # Verify initrd was created
        if [ -f "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" ]; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Initrd created successfully${NC}"
            ls -lh "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}"
        else
            echo -e "${RED}[!] Failed to create initrd - build may fail${NC}"
        fi

# Create boot configuration
create_boot_config() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Creating boot configuration...${NC}"
    
    # Verify kernel and initrd exist
    if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR"/chroot/boot/vmlinuz-* ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] No kernel found in chroot${NC}"
        # Find kernel in chroot
        find "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot" -name "vmlinuz*" -o -name "bzImage*" | head -1 || {
            echo -e "${RED}[!] No kernel image found at all${NC}"
            exit 1
        }
    fi
    
    # Copy kernel and initrd with error checking
    kernel_file=$(find "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot" -name "vmlinuz-*" | head -1)
    initrd_file=$(find "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot" -name "initrd.img-*" | head -1)
    
    if [ -n "$kernel_file" ]; then
        cp "$kernel_file" "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/vmlinuz"
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Kernel copied: $(basename $kernel_file)${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}[!] No kernel file found${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [ -n "$initrd_file" ]; then
        cp "$initrd_file" "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img"
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Initrd copied: $(basename $initrd_file)${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] No initrd file found - attempting to create one${NC}"
        # Try to create one as emergency fallback
        kernel_version=$(basename "$kernel_file" | sed 's/vmlinuz-//')
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Attempting to create emergency initrd for kernel $kernel_version${NC}"
        
        # Ensure chroot mounts are set up
        setup_chroot_mounts
        
        # Install initramfs-tools if not present
        if ! chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" which mkinitramfs >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Installing initramfs-tools for emergency initrd creation${NC}"
            chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" apt-get update
            chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends initramfs-tools initramfs-tools-core
        fi
        
        # Try multiple methods to create initrd
        initrd_created=false
        
        # Method 1: mkinitramfs
        if chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" which mkinitramfs >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Trying mkinitramfs...${NC}"
            if chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" mkinitramfs -o "/boot/initrd.img-emergency" "$kernel_version"; then
                cp "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-emergency" "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img"
                initrd_created=true
                echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Emergency initrd created with mkinitramfs${NC}"
            fi
        fi
        
        # Method 2: update-initramfs
        if [ "$initrd_created" = false ] && chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" which update-initramfs >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Trying update-initramfs...${NC}"
            if chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" update-initramfs -c -k "$kernel_version"; then
                if [ -f "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" ]; then
                    cp "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img"
                    initrd_created=true
                    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Emergency initrd created with update-initramfs${NC}"
                fi
            fi
        fi
        
        # Method 3: Copy any existing initrd as last resort
        if [ "$initrd_created" = false ]; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Looking for any existing initrd...${NC}"
            any_initrd=$(find "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot" -name "initrd*" -o -name "initramfs*" | head -1)
            if [ -n "$any_initrd" ]; then
                cp "$any_initrd" "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img"
                initrd_created=true
                echo -e "${YELLOW}[+] Using existing initrd: $(basename $any_initrd)${NC}"
            fi
        fi
        
        # Cleanup chroot mounts
        cleanup_chroot_mounts
        
        if [ "$initrd_created" = false ]; then
            echo -e "${RED}[!] Failed to create emergency initrd${NC}"
            echo -e "${RED}[!] The ISO may not boot properly${NC}"
            # Don't exit, let the user decide if they want to continue
            read -p "Continue anyway? (y/N): " -n 1 -r
            echo
            if [[ ! $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
                exit 1
            fi
        fi
    fi
    
    # Create isolinux configuration
    cat > "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/isolinux/isolinux.cfg" << EOF
DEFAULT ring-minus-one
PROMPT 1
TIMEOUT 300
UI menu.c32

MENU TITLE Ring -1 LiveCD Boot Menu
MENU BACKGROUND splash.png

LABEL ring-minus-one
  MENU LABEL Ring -1 Live System
  KERNEL /boot/vmlinuz
  APPEND initrd=/boot/initrd.img boot=live toram quiet splash systemd.unit=graphical.target
  
LABEL ring-minus-one-debug
  MENU LABEL Ring -1 Debug Mode
  KERNEL /boot/vmlinuz
  APPEND initrd=/boot/initrd.img boot=live toram debug systemd.log_level=debug
  
LABEL ring-minus-one-failsafe
  MENU LABEL Ring -1 Safe Mode
  KERNEL /boot/vmlinuz
  APPEND initrd=/boot/initrd.img boot=live toram nomodeset noapic acpi=off
  
LABEL ring-minus-one-text
  MENU LABEL Ring -1 Text Mode
  KERNEL /boot/vmlinuz
  APPEND initrd=/boot/initrd.img boot=live toram text systemd.unit=multi-user.target
EOF
    
    # Copy isolinux binaries with fallback paths
    if [ -f "/usr/lib/ISOLINUX/isolinux.bin" ]; then
        cp /usr/lib/ISOLINUX/isolinux.bin "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/isolinux/"
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] isolinux.bin copied${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}[!] isolinux.bin not found${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Copy syslinux modules with multiple fallback paths
    syslinux_paths=(
        "/usr/lib/syslinux/modules/bios"
        "/usr/share/syslinux"
        "/usr/lib/syslinux"
        "/boot/syslinux"
    )
    
    found_modules=false
    for path in "${syslinux_paths[@]}"; do
        if [ -d "$path" ]; then
            # Try to copy common modules
            for module in ldlinux.c32 libcom32.c32 libutil.c32 menu.c32 vesamenu.c32; do
                if [ -f "$path/$module" ]; then
                    cp "$path/$module" "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/isolinux/" 2>/dev/null || true
                    found_modules=true
                fi
            done
            [ "$found_modules" = true ] && break
        fi
    done
    
    if [ "$found_modules" = false ]; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] No syslinux modules found, creating minimal boot${NC}"
        # Create minimal isolinux config without modules
        cat > "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/isolinux/isolinux.cfg" << EOF
DEFAULT ring-minus-one
PROMPT 1
TIMEOUT 300

LABEL ring-minus-one
  KERNEL /boot/vmlinuz
  APPEND initrd=/boot/initrd.img boot=live toram quiet splash
EOF
    else
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Syslinux modules copied${NC}"
    fi
    
    monitor_memory
}

# Validate ISO structure before creation
validate_iso_structure() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Validating ISO structure...${NC}"
    
    local errors=0
    
    # Check essential files exist
    if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/vmlinuz" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Missing kernel: boot/vmlinuz${NC}"
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Missing initrd: boot/initrd.img${NC}"
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/isolinux/isolinux.bin" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Missing bootloader: boot/isolinux/isolinux.bin${NC}"
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/isolinux/isolinux.cfg" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Missing boot config: boot/isolinux/isolinux.cfg${NC}"
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/iso/live/filesystem.squashfs" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Missing filesystem: live/filesystem.squashfs${NC}"
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    # Check file sizes
    local kernel_size=$(stat -f%z "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/vmlinuz" 2>/dev/null || stat -c%s "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/vmlinuz" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
    local initrd_size=$(stat -f%z "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img" 2>/dev/null || stat -c%s "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
    local fs_size=$(stat -f%z "$WORK_DIR/iso/live/filesystem.squashfs" 2>/dev/null || stat -c%s "$WORK_DIR/iso/live/filesystem.squashfs" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
    
    # More flexible kernel size validation
    local min_kernel_size=1000000  # 1MB minimum
    if [ "$kernel_size" -lt "$min_kernel_size" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Kernel file too small: ${kernel_size} bytes (minimum: ${min_kernel_size})${NC}"
        ((errors++))
        
        # Try to identify the issue
        if [ "$kernel_size" -eq 0 ]; then
            echo -e "${RED}[!] Kernel file is empty or missing${NC}"
        fi
    else
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Kernel size OK: $(( kernel_size / 1024 / 1024 ))MB${NC}"
    fi
    
    if [ "$initrd_size" -lt 10000000 ]; then  # Less than 10MB
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Warning: initrd file seems small: ${initrd_size} bytes${NC}"
    fi
    
    if [ "$fs_size" -lt 100000000 ]; then  # Less than 100MB
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Warning: filesystem seems small: ${fs_size} bytes${NC}"
    fi
    
    if [ $errors -gt 0 ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] ISO validation failed with $errors errors${NC}"
        return 1
    else
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] ISO structure validation passed${NC}"
        return 0
    fi
}

# Create ISO image
create_iso() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Creating ISO image...${NC}"
    
    # Validate structure first
    if ! validate_iso_structure; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] ISO structure validation failed - aborting ISO creation${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Create ISO with error handling
    if xorriso -as mkisofs \
        -r -V "Ring-1-RAM" \
        -o "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" \
        -J -l \
        -b boot/isolinux/isolinux.bin \
        -c boot/isolinux/boot.cat \
        -no-emul-boot \
        -boot-load-size 4 \
        -boot-info-table \
        "$WORK_DIR/iso" 2>&1 | tee "$WORK_DIR/logs/xorriso.log"; then
        
        # Show final ISO size
        iso_size=$(du -h "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" | cut -f1)
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] ISO created successfully: $ISO_NAME ($iso_size)${NC}"
        
        # Verify ISO was actually created and has reasonable size
        if [ -f "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" ]; then
            iso_bytes=$(stat -f%z "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" 2>/dev/null || stat -c%s "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
            if [ "$iso_bytes" -gt 50000000 ]; then  # At least 50MB
                echo -e "${GREEN}[+] ISO validation passed (${iso_bytes} bytes)${NC}"
                
                # Create checksum
                md5sum "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" > "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME.md5"
                sha256sum "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" > "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME.sha256"
                echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Checksums created${NC}"
                
                return 0
            else
                echo -e "${RED}[!] ISO file too small: ${iso_bytes} bytes${NC}"
                return 1
            fi
        else
            echo -e "${RED}[!] ISO file was not created${NC}"
            return 1
        fi
    else
        echo -e "${RED}[!] xorriso failed to create ISO${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Check log: $WORK_DIR/logs/xorriso.log${NC}"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Enhanced cleanup with process tracking
cleanup() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Cleaning up workspace...${NC}"
    
    # Track and kill any remaining processes
    if [ -d "$WORK_DIR" ]; then
        local pids=$(lsof +D "$WORK_DIR" 2>/dev/null | awk 'NR>1 {print $2}' | sort -u)
        if [ -n "$pids" ]; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Killing processes using workspace:${NC}"
            for pid in $pids; do
                echo "  - PID $pid: $(ps -p $pid -o comm= 2>/dev/null || echo 'unknown')"
                kill -TERM $pid 2>/dev/null || true
            done
            sleep 2
            # Force kill if still running
            for pid in $pids; do
                kill -9 $pid 2>/dev/null || true
            done
        fi
    fi
    
    # Unmount tmpfs safely
    if mountpoint -q "$WORK_DIR" 2>/dev/null; then
        if ! cleanup_mount "$WORK_DIR"; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Force unmounting $WORK_DIR${NC}"
            umount -l "$WORK_DIR" 2>/dev/null || true
        fi
    fi
    
    # Remove directory if empty
    if [ -d "$WORK_DIR" ]; then
        if [ -z "$(ls -A $WORK_DIR 2>/dev/null)" ]; then
            rm -rf "$WORK_DIR"
            echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Workspace removed${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Workspace not empty, preserved at $WORK_DIR${NC}"
        fi
    fi
    
    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Cleanup complete${NC}"
}

# Setup chroot bind mounts
setup_chroot_mounts() {
    local chroot_dir="$WORK_DIR/chroot"
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Setting up chroot bind mounts...${NC}"
    
    mount -t proc proc "$chroot_dir/proc" || true
    mount -t sysfs sysfs "$chroot_dir/sys" || true
    mount --bind /dev "$chroot_dir/dev" || true
    mount --bind /dev/pts "$chroot_dir/dev/pts" || true
    mount -t tmpfs tmpfs "$chroot_dir/run" || true
}

# Cleanup chroot mounts
cleanup_chroot_mounts() {
    local chroot_dir="$WORK_DIR/chroot"
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Cleaning up chroot mounts...${NC}"
    
    # Kill any processes still running in chroot
    for pid in $(lsof +D "$chroot_dir" 2>/dev/null | awk 'NR>1 {print $2}' | sort -u); do
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Killing process $pid in chroot${NC}"
        kill -9 $pid 2>/dev/null || true
    done
    
    # Unmount in reverse order
    umount "$chroot_dir/run" 2>/dev/null || true
    umount "$chroot_dir/dev/pts" 2>/dev/null || true
    umount "$chroot_dir/dev" 2>/dev/null || true
    umount "$chroot_dir/sys" 2>/dev/null || true
    umount "$chroot_dir/proc" 2>/dev/null || true
}

cleanup_on_exit() {
    local exit_code=$?

        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Total build time: ${build_time}s${NC}"
    fi
    
    exit $exit_code
}

# Signal handler
cleanup_on_signal() {
    local signal=$1
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Received signal $signal, cleaning up...${NC}"
    cleanup_chroot_mounts
    cleanup
    exit 128

main() {

# Final system status

SERVICES=("dnsmasq" "tftpd-hpa" "apache2" "nfs-kernel-server")

#!/bin/bash
#
# Automated Optimized Kernel Builder
# Builds kernels with all Ring -1 optimizations
#

set -euo pipefail

YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
NC='\033[0m'

# Configuration
KERNEL_VERSION="${KERNEL_VERSION:-6.7}"
BUILD_DIR="/usr/src"
PROFILE="${1:-optimized}"
FEATURES=()

show_help() {
    echo "Advanced Kernel Builder with Ring -1 Optimizations"
    echo ""
    echo "Usage: $0 [profile] [options]"
    echo ""
    echo "Profiles:"
    echo "  optimized      - Standard optimized build (default)"
    echo "  max-performance - Maximum performance profile"
    echo "  dell-stealth   - Dell stealth profile"
    echo "  military       - Military grade profile"
    echo "  development    - Development profile"
    echo ""
    echo "Options:"
    echo "  --nvme         - Enable NVMe optimizations"
    echo "  --metrics      - Enable performance metrics"
    echo "  --dell-block   - Enable Dell blocking"
    echo "  --meteor-lake  - Enable Meteor Lake optimizations"
    echo "  --zfs          - Enable ZFS support"
    echo "  --install      - Install after build"
    echo "  --help         - Show this help"
    echo ""
    echo "Examples:"
    echo "  $0 optimized --install"
    echo "  $0 dell-stealth --nvme --dell-block"
    echo "  $0 max-performance --all"
}

parse_args() {
    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
        case $1 in
            --nvme)
                FEATURES+=("nvme")
                shift
                ;;
            --metrics)
                FEATURES+=("metrics")
                shift
                ;;
            --dell-block)
                FEATURES+=("dell-block")
                shift
                ;;
            --meteor-lake)
                FEATURES+=("meteor-lake")
                shift
                ;;
            --zfs)
                FEATURES+=("zfs")
                shift
                ;;
            --install)
                INSTALL_AFTER="true"
                shift
                ;;
            --all)
                FEATURES=("nvme" "metrics" "dell-block" "meteor-lake" "zfs")
                shift
                ;;
            --help)
                show_help
                exit 0
                ;;
            *)
                echo "Unknown option: $1"
                show_help
                exit 1
                ;;
        esac
    done
}

apply_profile_config() {
    local profile="$1"
    
    case "$profile" in
        "optimized")
            FEATURES+=("nvme" "metrics" "meteor-lake")
            ;;
        "max-performance")
            FEATURES+=("nvme" "metrics" "meteor-lake")
            echo "CONFIG_CC_OPTIMIZE_FOR_PERFORMANCE_O3=y" >> .config
            echo "CONFIG_LTO_CLANG_FULL=y" >> .config
            ;;
        "dell-stealth")
            FEATURES+=("dell-block" "nvme" "meteor-lake")
            ;;
        "military")
            FEATURES+=("nvme" "metrics" "dell-block" "meteor-lake" "zfs")
            echo "CONFIG_SECURITY_SELINUX=y" >> .config
            echo "CONFIG_SECURITY_APPARMOR=y" >> .config
            ;;
        "development")
            FEATURES+=("nvme" "metrics" "meteor-lake")
            echo "CONFIG_DEBUG_KERNEL=y" >> .config
            echo "CONFIG_DEBUG_INFO=y" >> .config
            ;;
    esac
}

apply_nvme_optimizations() {
    echo -e "${CYAN}[*] Applying NVMe optimizations...${NC}"
    
    # NVMe core optimizations
    cat >> .config << 'NVME_CONFIG'
# NVMe Optimizations
CONFIG_NVME_CORE=y
CONFIG_NVME_MULTIPATH=y
CONFIG_NVME_VERBOSE_ERRORS=y
CONFIG_NVME_TCP=y
CONFIG_NVME_FC=y
CONFIG_NVME_RDMA=y

# Block layer optimizations
CONFIG_BLK_DEV_THROTTLING=n
CONFIG_BLK_WBT=n
CONFIG_BLK_DEV_INTEGRITY=n
CONFIG_BLK_CGROUP=n

# I/O schedulers
CONFIG_IOSCHED_DEADLINE=y
CONFIG_IOSCHED_CFQ=n
CONFIG_DEFAULT_DEADLINE=y
NVME_CONFIG
}

apply_meteor_lake_optimizations() {
    echo -e "${CYAN}[*] Applying Intel Meteor Lake optimizations...${NC}"
    
    cat >> .config << 'METEOR_CONFIG'
# Intel Meteor Lake Optimizations
CONFIG_MCORE2=y
CONFIG_X86_INTEL_PSTATE=y
CONFIG_X86_P4_CLOCKMOD=n
CONFIG_X86_SPEEDSTEP_CENTRINO=n
CONFIG_X86_ACPI_CPUFREQ=y

# NPU support
CONFIG_INTEL_MEI=y
CONFIG_INTEL_MEI_ME=y
CONFIG_INTEL_MEI_GSC=y

# Performance monitoring
CONFIG_PERF_EVENTS=y
CONFIG_PERF_EVENTS_INTEL_UNCORE=y
CONFIG_PERF_EVENTS_INTEL_RAPL=y
CONFIG_PERF_EVENTS_INTEL_CSTATE=y
CONFIG_X86_MSR=y
CONFIG_X86_CPUID=y

# Memory optimizations
CONFIG_TRANSPARENT_HUGEPAGE=y
CONFIG_TRANSPARENT_HUGEPAGE_ALWAYS=y
CONFIG_COMPACTION=y
CONFIG_MIGRATION=y
METEOR_CONFIG
}

apply_dell_blocking() {
    echo -e "${CYAN}[*] Applying Dell blocking...${NC}"
    
    cat >> .config << 'DELL_BLOCK_CONFIG'
# Dell Driver Blocking
CONFIG_DELL_LAPTOP=n
CONFIG_DELL_SMBIOS=n
CONFIG_DELL_SMBIOS_DMI=n
CONFIG_DELL_SMBIOS_SMM=n
CONFIG_DELL_SMBIOS_WMI=n
CONFIG_DELL_RBTN=n
CONFIG_DELL_RBU=n
CONFIG_DELL_SMO8800=n
CONFIG_DELL_WMI=n
CONFIG_DELL_WMI_AIO=n
CONFIG_DELL_WMI_LED=n
CONFIG_DELL_WMI_DESCRIPTOR=n
CONFIG_DCDBAS=n
CONFIG_SENSORS_DELL_SMM=n
DELL_BLOCK_CONFIG
}

apply_performance_metrics() {
    echo -e "${CYAN}[*] Applying performance metrics...${NC}"
    
    cat >> .config << 'METRICS_CONFIG'
# Performance Metrics
CONFIG_PERF_EVENTS=y
CONFIG_PERF_EVENTS_INTEL_UNCORE=y
CONFIG_PERF_EVENTS_INTEL_RAPL=y
CONFIG_PERF_EVENTS_INTEL_CSTATE=y
CONFIG_HW_PERF_EVENTS=y
CONFIG_PERF_USE_VMALLOC=y

# Tracing
CONFIG_FTRACE=y
CONFIG_FUNCTION_TRACER=y
CONFIG_IRQSOFF_TRACER=y
CONFIG_SCHED_TRACER=y

# Statistics
CONFIG_TASK_DELAY_ACCT=y
CONFIG_TASK_XACCT=y
CONFIG_TASK_IO_ACCOUNTING=y
METRICS_CONFIG
}

    echo -e "${CYAN}[*] Applying ZFS support...${NC}"
    
    cat >> .config << 'ZFS_CONFIG'
# ZFS Support
CONFIG_SPL=m
CONFIG_ZFS=m

# Required for ZFS
CONFIG_ZLIB_INFLATE=y
CONFIG_ZLIB_DEFLATE=y
CONFIG_CRC32=y
CONFIG_LIBCRC32C=y
ZFS_CONFIG
}

main() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}=== Advanced Kernel Builder ===${NC}"
    echo ""
    
    # Parse arguments
    if [[ $# -gt 1 ]]; then
        shift  # Skip profile argument
        parse_args "$@"
    fi
    
    # Check if running as root
    if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then
        echo -e "${RED}Error: This script must be run as root${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Apply Dell protection first
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Applying Dell protection...${NC}"
    if command -v quick-kernel-block >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        quick-kernel-block
    fi
    
    # Create build directory
    mkdir -p "$BUILD_DIR"
    cd "$BUILD_DIR"
    
    # Download kernel source if needed
    if [[ ! -d "linux-$KERNEL_VERSION" ]]; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Downloading kernel source...${NC}"
        wget -q "https://cdn.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v6.x/linux-$KERNEL_VERSION.tar.xz"
        tar xf "linux-$KERNEL_VERSION.tar.xz"
    fi
    
    cd "linux-$KERNEL_VERSION"
    
    # Clean previous build
    make mrproper
    
    # Start with current config
    if [[ -f /boot/config-$(uname -r) ]]; then
        cp "/boot/config-$(uname -r)" .config
    else
        make defconfig
    fi
    
    # Apply profile configuration
    apply_profile_config "$PROFILE"
    
    # Apply feature optimizations
    for feature in "${FEATURES[@]}"; do
        case "$feature" in
            "nvme")
                apply_nvme_optimizations
                ;;
            "meteor-lake")
                apply_meteor_lake_optimizations
                ;;
            "dell-block")
                apply_dell_blocking
                ;;
            "metrics")
                apply_performance_metrics
                ;;
            "zfs")
                apply_zfs_support
                ;;
        esac
    done
    
    # Update config
    make olddefconfig
    
    # Build kernel
    echo -e "${GREEN}[*] Building optimized kernel...${NC}"
    echo "Profile: $PROFILE"
    echo "Features: ${FEATURES[*]}"
    echo ""
    
    make -j$(nproc) bindeb-pkg
    
    # Install if requested
    if [[ "${INSTALL_AFTER:-false}" == "true" ]]; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}[*] Installing kernel packages...${NC}"
        dpkg -i ../linux-*.deb
        
        # Update GRUB
        update-grub
        
        # Update ZFS boot menu if available
        if command -v update-zbm >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            update-zbm
        fi
    fi
    
    echo ""
    echo -e "${GREEN}=== Kernel Build Complete! ===${NC}"
    echo "Built packages:"
    ls -la ../linux-*.deb
    
    if [[ "${INSTALL_AFTER:-false}" == "true" ]]; then
        echo ""
        echo -e "${YELLOW}Reboot to use the new kernel.${NC}"
    fi
}

# Check for help first
if [[ "${1:-}" == "--help" ]] || [[ "${1:-}" == "-h" ]]; then

    exit 0

        parse_args "$@"
    fi
    
    # Check if running as root
    if [[ $EUID -ne 0 ]]; then
        echo -e "${RED}Error: This script must be run as root${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Apply Dell protection first
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Applying Dell protection...${NC}"
    if command -v quick-kernel-block >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        quick-kernel-block
    fi
    
    # Create build directory
    mkdir -p "$BUILD_DIR"
    cd "$BUILD_DIR"
    
    # Download kernel source if needed
    if [[ ! -d "linux-$KERNEL_VERSION" ]]; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Downloading kernel source...${NC}"
        wget -q "https://cdn.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v6.x/linux-$KERNEL_VERSION.tar.xz"
        tar xf "linux-$KERNEL_VERSION.tar.xz"
    fi
    
    cd "linux-$KERNEL_VERSION"
    
    # Clean previous build
    make mrproper
    
    # Start with current config
    if [[ -f /boot/config-$(uname -r) ]]; then
        cp "/boot/config-$(uname -r)" .config
    else
        make defconfig
    fi
    
    # Apply profile configuration
    apply_profile_config "$PROFILE"
    
    # Apply feature optimizations
    for feature in "${FEATURES[@]}"; do
        case "$feature" in
            "nvme")
                apply_nvme_optimizations
                ;;
            "meteor-lake")
                apply_meteor_lake_optimizations
                ;;
            "dell-block")
                apply_dell_blocking
                ;;
            "metrics")
                apply_performance_metrics
                ;;
            "zfs")
                apply_zfs_support
                ;;
        esac
    done
    
    # Update config
    make olddefconfig
    
    # Build kernel
    echo -e "${GREEN}[*] Building optimized kernel...${NC}"
    echo "Profile: $PROFILE"
    echo "Features: ${FEATURES[*]}"
    echo ""
    
    make -j$(nproc) bindeb-pkg
    
    # Install if requested
    if [[ "${INSTALL_AFTER:-false}" == "true" ]]; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}[*] Installing kernel packages...${NC}"
        dpkg -i ../linux-*.deb
        
        # Update GRUB
        update-grub
        
        # Update ZFS boot menu if available
        if command -v update-zbm >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            update-zbm
        fi
    fi
    
    echo ""
    echo -e "${GREEN}=== Kernel Build Complete! ===${NC}"
    echo "Built packages:"
    ls -la ../linux-*.deb
    
    if [[ "${INSTALL_AFTER:-false}" == "true" ]]; then
        echo ""
        echo -e "${YELLOW}Reboot to use the new kernel.${NC}"
    fi
}

    show_help
    exit 0
fi
