#!/bin/bash
#
# Ring -1 LiveCD Builder - RAM-Based Edition with Full livecd-gen Integration
# Builds entire system in tmpfs to minimize disk usage
# Includes IOMMU workarounds and virtio fallbacks
# Integrates all livecd-gen tools and features
#

set -e

# Color codes for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
PURPLE='\033[0;35m'
CYAN='\033[0;36m'
WHITE='\033[1;37m'
NC='\033[0m'

# Configuration
WORK_DIR="/dev/shm/ring-minus-one-build"
OUTPUT_DIR="$(pwd)/output"
ISO_NAME="ring-minus-one-ram-$(date +%Y%m%d).iso"
TMPFS_SIZE="20G"  # Increased for KDE + kernel toolchain + all livecd-gen tools
MIN_RAM_GB=8
MIN_DISK_GB=2
MAX_PARALLEL_JOBS=4
OPERATION_TIMEOUT=300  # 5 minutes timeout for operations
MEMORY_THRESHOLD_KB=$((2 * 1024 * 1024))  # 2GB minimum free memory
BUILD_START_TIME=$(date +%s)

# livecd-gen paths
LIVECD_GEN_DIR="$(dirname "$(readlink -f "$0")")"
LIB_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/lib"
SRC_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/src"
SCRIPTS_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/scripts"
CONFIG_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/config"
PLUGINS_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/plugins"
SECURITY_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/security-research-toolkit"
HARDWARE_DIR="${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}/hardware-profiles"

# Source common library if available
if [ -f "${LIB_DIR}/common.sh" ]; then
    source "${LIB_DIR}/common.sh"
fi

# System checks
check_requirements() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Checking system requirements...${NC}"
    
    # Check RAM
    total_ram=$(free -g | awk '/^Mem:/{print $2}')
    if [ "$total_ram" -lt "$MIN_RAM_GB" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Insufficient RAM: ${total_ram}GB available, ${MIN_RAM_GB}GB required${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] RAM check passed: ${total_ram}GB available${NC}"
    
    # Check disk space (only for final ISO)
    available_disk=$(df -BG . | awk 'NR==2 {print $4}' | sed 's/G//')
    if [ "$available_disk" -lt "$MIN_DISK_GB" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Insufficient disk space: ${available_disk}GB available, ${MIN_DISK_GB}GB required${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Disk check passed: ${available_disk}GB available${NC}"
    
    # Check for required tools with error handling
    for tool in debootstrap squashfs-tools xorriso isolinux syslinux-utils syslinux-common; do
        if ! command -v $tool &> /dev/null && ! dpkg -l | grep -q "^ii.*$tool"; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Installing $tool...${NC}"
            local retries=3
            while [ $retries -gt 0 ]; do
                if apt-get update && apt-get install -y $tool; then
                    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Successfully installed $tool${NC}"
                    break
                fi
                ((retries--))
                if [ $retries -gt 0 ]; then
                    echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Installation failed, retrying... ($retries attempts left)${NC}"
                    sleep 2
                else
                    echo -e "${RED}[!] Failed to install required tool: $tool${NC}"
                    exit 1
                fi
            done
        fi
    done
    
    # Validate tmpfs size against available RAM
    local tmpfs_size_gb=$(echo "$TMPFS_SIZE" | sed 's/G//')
    if [ "$tmpfs_size_gb" -gt "$total_ram" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Requested tmpfs size (${tmpfs_size_gb}GB) exceeds available RAM (${total_ram}GB)${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Adjusting tmpfs size to ${total_ram}GB${NC}"
        TMPFS_SIZE="${total_ram}G"
    fi
    
    # Ensure essential boot components are available
    if [ ! -f "/usr/lib/ISOLINUX/isolinux.bin" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] isolinux.bin not found - installing isolinux${NC}"
        apt-get install -y isolinux
    fi
    
    # Check virtualization support (but don't fail if missing)
    if [ -e /dev/kvm ]; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] KVM support detected${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] No KVM support - will use software emulation fallback${NC}"
    fi
    
    # Check IOMMU (informational only)
    if dmesg | grep -q "IOMMU"; then
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] IOMMU detected (may not be enabled)${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] No IOMMU detected - using virtio fallbacks${NC}"
    fi
}

# Safe cleanup of existing mount
cleanup_mount() {
    local mount_point="$1"
    local retries=5
    
    while mountpoint -q "$mount_point" 2>/dev/null && [ $retries -gt 0 ]; do
        # Try graceful unmount first
        if umount "$mount_point" 2>/dev/null; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Successfully unmounted $mount_point${NC}"
            return 0
        fi
        
        # Check for processes using the mount
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Mount busy, checking processes...${NC}"
        lsof +D "$mount_point" 2>/dev/null || true
        
        # Kill processes if needed
        if [ $retries -eq 2 ]; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Attempting to kill processes using mount${NC}"
            fuser -km "$mount_point" 2>/dev/null || true
        fi
        
        sleep 2
        ((retries--))
    done
    
    if mountpoint -q "$mount_point" 2>/dev/null; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Failed to unmount $mount_point safely${NC}"
        return 1
    fi
    return 0
}

# Setup tmpfs workspace with proper error handling
setup_tmpfs() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Setting up tmpfs workspace...${NC}"
    
    # Clean up any existing mount safely
    if mountpoint -q "$WORK_DIR" 2>/dev/null; then
        if ! cleanup_mount "$WORK_DIR"; then
            echo -e "${RED}[!] Cannot proceed with busy mount point${NC}"
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
    
    # Create and mount tmpfs with error checking
    mkdir -p "$WORK_DIR"
    if ! mount -t tmpfs -o size="$TMPFS_SIZE" tmpfs "$WORK_DIR"; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Failed to mount tmpfs at $WORK_DIR${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Create directory structure
    mkdir -p "$WORK_DIR"/{chroot,iso/{boot/isolinux,live},tmp}
    mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$WORK_DIR"/logs
    
    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Tmpfs mounted: $(df -h $WORK_DIR | tail -1)${NC}"
}

# Monitor memory usage with exhaustion detection
monitor_memory() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Current memory usage:${NC}"
    free -h
    df -h "$WORK_DIR" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Check for memory exhaustion
    local available_kb=$(awk '/MemAvailable/ {print $2}' /proc/meminfo)
    if [ "$available_kb" -lt "$MEMORY_THRESHOLD_KB" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] WARNING: Low memory detected ($(( available_kb / 1024 ))MB available)${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Build may fail due to insufficient memory${NC}"
        
        # Try to free some memory
        sync
        echo 3 > /proc/sys/vm/drop_caches 2>/dev/null || true
        
        # Re-check after cleanup
        available_kb=$(awk '/MemAvailable/ {print $2}' /proc/meminfo)
        if [ "$available_kb" -lt "$((MEMORY_THRESHOLD_KB / 2))" ]; then
            echo -e "${RED}[!] CRITICAL: Memory too low to continue safely${NC}"
            return 1
        fi
    fi
    return 0
}

# Create full-featured base system with all tools
create_base_system() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Creating full-featured base system with cdebootstrap...${NC}"
    
    # Install cdebootstrap if not available
    if ! command -v cdebootstrap &> /dev/null; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Installing cdebootstrap...${NC}"
        apt-get update && apt-get install -y cdebootstrap
    fi
    
    # Use cdebootstrap for faster and more reliable base system creation
    # Start with minimal base then add packages in stages
    cdebootstrap --arch=amd64 \
        --flavour=build \
        --include=linux-image-generic,systemd-sysv,initramfs-tools,busybox-initramfs,apt,wget,curl \
        jammy "$WORK_DIR/chroot" http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/
    
    # Setup apt sources for universe repository
    cat > "$WORK_DIR/chroot/etc/apt/sources.list" << EOF
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy main restricted universe multiverse
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-updates main restricted universe multiverse
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy-security main restricted universe multiverse
EOF
    
    # Setup chroot bind mounts for proper functionality
    setup_chroot_mounts
    
    # Install casper and live system packages after base system is ready
    chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" apt-get update
    
    # Ensure initramfs-tools is installed before trying to use it
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Installing essential boot packages...${NC}"
    chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
        initramfs-tools \
        initramfs-tools-core \
        casper \
        live-config \
        live-config-systemd \
        syslinux-common \
        busybox-static \
        zstd
    
    # Get kernel version
    kernel_version=$(chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" ls /lib/modules/ | head -1)
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Generating initrd for kernel ${kernel_version}...${NC}"
    
    # Multiple methods to ensure initrd creation
    if [ -n "$kernel_version" ]; then
        # Method 1: Try update-initramfs
        if chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" which update-initramfs >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Using update-initramfs...${NC}"
            chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" update-initramfs -c -k "$kernel_version" || \
            chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" update-initramfs -u -k "$kernel_version" || \
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] update-initramfs failed${NC}"
        fi
        
        # Method 2: Try mkinitramfs directly
        if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" ]; then
            if chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" which mkinitramfs >/dev/null 2>&1; then
                echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Using mkinitramfs directly...${NC}"
                chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" mkinitramfs -o "/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" "$kernel_version" || \
                echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] mkinitramfs failed${NC}"
            fi
        fi
        
        # Method 3: Try dracut if available
        if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" ]; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[*] Installing dracut as fallback...${NC}"
            chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends dracut-core 2>/dev/null && \
            chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" dracut --force "/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" "$kernel_version" 2>/dev/null || \
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] dracut failed or not available${NC}"
        fi
        
        # Verify initrd was created
        if [ -f "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" ]; then
            echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Initrd created successfully${NC}"
            ls -lh "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}"
        else
            echo -e "${RED}[!] Failed to create initrd - build may fail${NC}"
        fi
    else
        echo -e "${RED}[!] No kernel version found${NC}"
    fi
    
    # Copy livecd-gen resources into chroot with path validation
    if [ -d "${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}" ]; then
        echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Integrating livecd-gen components...${NC}"
        # Validate paths to prevent traversal
        for dir in "${SCRIPTS_DIR}" "${SRC_DIR}" "${CONFIG_DIR}"; do
            if [ -d "$dir" ]; then
                local realpath=$(realpath "$dir")
                if [[ "$realpath" == "${LIVECD_GEN_DIR}"* ]]; then
                    local basename=$(basename "$dir")
                    cp -r "$dir" "$WORK_DIR/chroot/opt/livecd-$basename" || {
                        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Failed to copy $basename${NC}"
                    }
                else
                    echo -e "${RED}[!] Path validation failed for $dir${NC}"
                fi
            fi
        done
    fi
    
    # Setup basic system
    cat > "$WORK_DIR/chroot/etc/hostname" << EOF
ring-minus-one
EOF
    
    cat > "$WORK_DIR/chroot/etc/hosts" << EOF
127.0.0.1       localhost
127.0.1.1       ring-minus-one
EOF
    
    # Create minimal fstab
    cat > "$WORK_DIR/chroot/etc/fstab" << EOF
# Ring -1 LiveCD fstab
tmpfs   /tmp    tmpfs   defaults        0       0
EOF
    
    monitor_memory
}

# Install comprehensive tool suite

    echo -e "${CYAN}[*] Installing comprehensive tool suite...${NC}"
    
    # Update package lists
    chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" apt-get update

}

exec qemu-system-x86_64 $QEMU_ARGS

# Create boot configuration
create_boot_config() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Creating boot configuration...${NC}"
    
    # Verify kernel and initrd exist
    if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR"/chroot/boot/vmlinuz-* ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] No kernel found in chroot${NC}"
        # Find kernel in chroot
        find "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot" -name "vmlinuz*" -o -name "bzImage*" | head -1 || {
            echo -e "${RED}[!] No kernel image found at all${NC}"
            exit 1
        }
    fi
    
    # Copy kernel and initrd with error checking
    kernel_file=$(find "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot" -name "vmlinuz-*" | head -1)
    initrd_file=$(find "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot" -name "initrd.img-*" | head -1)
    
    if [ -n "$kernel_file" ]; then
        cp "$kernel_file" "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/vmlinuz"
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Kernel copied: $(basename $kernel_file)${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}[!] No kernel file found${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [ -n "$initrd_file" ]; then
        cp "$initrd_file" "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img"
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Initrd copied: $(basename $initrd_file)${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] No initrd file found - attempting to create one${NC}"
        # Try to create one as emergency fallback
        kernel_version=$(basename "$kernel_file" | sed 's/vmlinuz-//')
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Attempting to create emergency initrd for kernel $kernel_version${NC}"
        
        # Ensure chroot mounts are set up
        setup_chroot_mounts
        
        # Install initramfs-tools if not present
        if ! chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" which mkinitramfs >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Installing initramfs-tools for emergency initrd creation${NC}"
            chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" apt-get update
            chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends initramfs-tools initramfs-tools-core
        fi
        
        # Try multiple methods to create initrd
        initrd_created=false
        
        # Method 1: mkinitramfs
        if chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" which mkinitramfs >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Trying mkinitramfs...${NC}"
            if chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" mkinitramfs -o "/boot/initrd.img-emergency" "$kernel_version"; then
                cp "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-emergency" "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img"
                initrd_created=true
                echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Emergency initrd created with mkinitramfs${NC}"
            fi
        fi
        
        # Method 2: update-initramfs
        if [ "$initrd_created" = false ] && chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" which update-initramfs >/dev/null 2>&1; then
            echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Trying update-initramfs...${NC}"
            if chroot "$WORK_DIR/chroot" update-initramfs -c -k "$kernel_version"; then
                if [ -f "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" ]; then
                    cp "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot/initrd.img-${kernel_version}" "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img"
                    initrd_created=true
                    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Emergency initrd created with update-initramfs${NC}"
                fi
            fi
        fi
        
        # Method 3: Copy any existing initrd as last resort
        if [ "$initrd_created" = false ]; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Looking for any existing initrd...${NC}"
            any_initrd=$(find "$WORK_DIR/chroot/boot" -name "initrd*" -o -name "initramfs*" | head -1)
            if [ -n "$any_initrd" ]; then
                cp "$any_initrd" "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img"
                initrd_created=true
                echo -e "${YELLOW}[+] Using existing initrd: $(basename $any_initrd)${NC}"
            fi
        fi
        
        # Cleanup chroot mounts
        cleanup_chroot_mounts
        
        if [ "$initrd_created" = false ]; then
            echo -e "${RED}[!] Failed to create emergency initrd${NC}"
            echo -e "${RED}[!] The ISO may not boot properly${NC}"
            # Don't exit, let the user decide if they want to continue
            read -p "Continue anyway? (y/N): " -n 1 -r
            echo
            if [[ ! $REPLY =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
                exit 1
            fi
        fi
    fi
    
    # Create isolinux configuration
    cat > "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/isolinux/isolinux.cfg" << EOF
DEFAULT ring-minus-one
PROMPT 1
TIMEOUT 300
UI menu.c32

MENU TITLE Ring -1 LiveCD Boot Menu
MENU BACKGROUND splash.png

LABEL ring-minus-one
  MENU LABEL Ring -1 Live System
  KERNEL /boot/vmlinuz
  APPEND initrd=/boot/initrd.img boot=live toram quiet splash systemd.unit=graphical.target
  
LABEL ring-minus-one-debug
  MENU LABEL Ring -1 Debug Mode
  KERNEL /boot/vmlinuz
  APPEND initrd=/boot/initrd.img boot=live toram debug systemd.log_level=debug
  
LABEL ring-minus-one-failsafe
  MENU LABEL Ring -1 Safe Mode
  KERNEL /boot/vmlinuz
  APPEND initrd=/boot/initrd.img boot=live toram nomodeset noapic acpi=off
  
LABEL ring-minus-one-text
  MENU LABEL Ring -1 Text Mode
  KERNEL /boot/vmlinuz
  APPEND initrd=/boot/initrd.img boot=live toram text systemd.unit=multi-user.target
EOF
    
    # Copy isolinux binaries with fallback paths
    if [ -f "/usr/lib/ISOLINUX/isolinux.bin" ]; then
        cp /usr/lib/ISOLINUX/isolinux.bin "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/isolinux/"
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] isolinux.bin copied${NC}"
    else
        echo -e "${RED}[!] isolinux.bin not found${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Copy syslinux modules with multiple fallback paths
    syslinux_paths=(
        "/usr/lib/syslinux/modules/bios"
        "/usr/share/syslinux"
        "/usr/lib/syslinux"
        "/boot/syslinux"
    )
    
    found_modules=false
    for path in "${syslinux_paths[@]}"; do
        if [ -d "$path" ]; then
            # Try to copy common modules
            for module in ldlinux.c32 libcom32.c32 libutil.c32 menu.c32 vesamenu.c32; do
                if [ -f "$path/$module" ]; then
                    cp "$path/$module" "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/isolinux/" 2>/dev/null || true
                    found_modules=true
                fi
            done
            [ "$found_modules" = true ] && break
        fi
    done
    
    if [ "$found_modules" = false ]; then
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] No syslinux modules found, creating minimal boot${NC}"
        # Create minimal isolinux config without modules
        cat > "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/isolinux/isolinux.cfg" << EOF
DEFAULT ring-minus-one
PROMPT 1
TIMEOUT 300

LABEL ring-minus-one
  KERNEL /boot/vmlinuz
  APPEND initrd=/boot/initrd.img boot=live toram quiet splash
EOF
    else
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Syslinux modules copied${NC}"
    fi
    
    monitor_memory
}

    mksquashfs "$WORK_DIR/chroot" "$WORK_DIR/iso/live/filesystem.squashfs" \

# Validate ISO structure before creation
validate_iso_structure() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Validating ISO structure...${NC}"
    
    local errors=0
    
    # Check essential files exist
    if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/vmlinuz" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Missing kernel: boot/vmlinuz${NC}"
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Missing initrd: boot/initrd.img${NC}"
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/isolinux/isolinux.bin" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Missing bootloader: boot/isolinux/isolinux.bin${NC}"
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/isolinux/isolinux.cfg" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Missing boot config: boot/isolinux/isolinux.cfg${NC}"
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    if [ ! -f "$WORK_DIR/iso/live/filesystem.squashfs" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Missing filesystem: live/filesystem.squashfs${NC}"
        ((errors++))
    fi
    
    # Check file sizes
    local kernel_size=$(stat -f%z "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/vmlinuz" 2>/dev/null || stat -c%s "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/vmlinuz" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
    local initrd_size=$(stat -f%z "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img" 2>/dev/null || stat -c%s "$WORK_DIR/iso/boot/initrd.img" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
    local fs_size=$(stat -f%z "$WORK_DIR/iso/live/filesystem.squashfs" 2>/dev/null || stat -c%s "$WORK_DIR/iso/live/filesystem.squashfs" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
    
    # More flexible kernel size validation
    local min_kernel_size=1000000  # 1MB minimum
    if [ "$kernel_size" -lt "$min_kernel_size" ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] Kernel file too small: ${kernel_size} bytes (minimum: ${min_kernel_size})${NC}"
        ((errors++))
        
        # Try to identify the issue
        if [ "$kernel_size" -eq 0 ]; then
            echo -e "${RED}[!] Kernel file is empty or missing${NC}"
        fi
    else
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Kernel size OK: $(( kernel_size / 1024 / 1024 ))MB${NC}"
    fi
    
    if [ "$initrd_size" -lt 10000000 ]; then  # Less than 10MB
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Warning: initrd file seems small: ${initrd_size} bytes${NC}"
    fi
    
    if [ "$fs_size" -lt 100000000 ]; then  # Less than 100MB
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Warning: filesystem seems small: ${fs_size} bytes${NC}"
    fi
    
    if [ $errors -gt 0 ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] ISO validation failed with $errors errors${NC}"
        return 1
    else
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] ISO structure validation passed${NC}"
        return 0
    fi
}

# Create ISO image
create_iso() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Creating ISO image...${NC}"
    
    # Validate structure first
    if ! validate_iso_structure; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] ISO structure validation failed - aborting ISO creation${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Create ISO with error handling
    if xorriso -as mkisofs \
        -r -V "Ring-1-RAM" \
        -o "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" \
        -J -l \
        -b boot/isolinux/isolinux.bin \
        -c boot/isolinux/boot.cat \
        -no-emul-boot \
        -boot-load-size 4 \
        -boot-info-table \
        "$WORK_DIR/iso" 2>&1 | tee "$WORK_DIR/logs/xorriso.log"; then
        
        # Show final ISO size
        iso_size=$(du -h "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" | cut -f1)
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] ISO created successfully: $ISO_NAME ($iso_size)${NC}"
        
        # Verify ISO was actually created and has reasonable size
        if [ -f "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" ]; then
            iso_bytes=$(stat -f%z "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" 2>/dev/null || stat -c%s "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
            if [ "$iso_bytes" -gt 50000000 ]; then  # At least 50MB
                echo -e "${GREEN}[+] ISO validation passed (${iso_bytes} bytes)${NC}"
                
                # Create checksum
                md5sum "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" > "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME.md5"
                sha256sum "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME" > "$OUTPUT_DIR/$ISO_NAME.sha256"
                echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Checksums created${NC}"
                
                return 0
            else
                echo -e "${RED}[!] ISO file too small: ${iso_bytes} bytes${NC}"
                return 1
            fi
        else
            echo -e "${RED}[!] ISO file was not created${NC}"
            return 1
        fi
    else
        echo -e "${RED}[!] xorriso failed to create ISO${NC}"
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Check log: $WORK_DIR/logs/xorriso.log${NC}"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Enhanced cleanup with process tracking
cleanup() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Cleaning up workspace...${NC}"
    
    # Track and kill any remaining processes
    if [ -d "$WORK_DIR" ]; then
        local pids=$(lsof +D "$WORK_DIR" 2>/dev/null | awk 'NR>1 {print $2}' | sort -u)
        if [ -n "$pids" ]; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Killing processes using workspace:${NC}"
            for pid in $pids; do
                echo "  - PID $pid: $(ps -p $pid -o comm= 2>/dev/null || echo 'unknown')"
                kill -TERM $pid 2>/dev/null || true
            done
            sleep 2
            # Force kill if still running
            for pid in $pids; do
                kill -9 $pid 2>/dev/null || true
            done
        fi
    fi
    
    # Unmount tmpfs safely
    if mountpoint -q "$WORK_DIR" 2>/dev/null; then
        if ! cleanup_mount "$WORK_DIR"; then
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Force unmounting $WORK_DIR${NC}"
            umount -l "$WORK_DIR" 2>/dev/null || true
        fi
    fi
    
    # Remove directory if empty
    if [ -d "$WORK_DIR" ]; then
        if [ -z "$(ls -A $WORK_DIR 2>/dev/null)" ]; then
            rm -rf "$WORK_DIR"
            echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Workspace removed${NC}"
        else
            echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Workspace not empty, preserved at $WORK_DIR${NC}"
        fi
    fi
    
    echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Cleanup complete${NC}"
}

# Setup chroot bind mounts
setup_chroot_mounts() {
    local chroot_dir="$WORK_DIR/chroot"
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Setting up chroot bind mounts...${NC}"
    
    mount -t proc proc "$chroot_dir/proc" || true
    mount -t sysfs sysfs "$chroot_dir/sys" || true
    mount --bind /dev "$chroot_dir/dev" || true
    mount --bind /dev/pts "$chroot_dir/dev/pts" || true
    mount -t tmpfs tmpfs "$chroot_dir/run" || true
}

# Cleanup chroot mounts
cleanup_chroot_mounts() {
    local chroot_dir="$WORK_DIR/chroot"
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Cleaning up chroot mounts...${NC}"
    
    # Kill any processes still running in chroot
    for pid in $(lsof +D "$chroot_dir" 2>/dev/null | awk 'NR>1 {print $2}' | sort -u); do
        echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Killing process $pid in chroot${NC}"
        kill -9 $pid 2>/dev/null || true
    done
    
    # Unmount in reverse order
    umount "$chroot_dir/run" 2>/dev/null || true
    umount "$chroot_dir/dev/pts" 2>/dev/null || true
    umount "$chroot_dir/dev" 2>/dev/null || true
    umount "$chroot_dir/sys" 2>/dev/null || true
    umount "$chroot_dir/proc" 2>/dev/null || true
}

# Enhanced cleanup with signal handling
cleanup_on_exit() {
    local exit_code=$?
    echo -e "${BLUE}[*] Cleaning up (exit code: $exit_code)...${NC}"
    
    # Cleanup chroot mounts first
    cleanup_chroot_mounts
    
    # Then cleanup main workspace
    cleanup
    
    # Calculate and show build time
    if [ -n "$BUILD_START_TIME" ]; then
        local build_time=$(($(date +%s) - BUILD_START_TIME))
        echo -e "${GREEN}[+] Total build time: ${build_time}s${NC}"
    fi
    
    exit $exit_code
}

# Signal handler
cleanup_on_signal() {
    local signal=$1
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[!] Received signal $signal, cleaning up...${NC}"
    cleanup_chroot_mounts
    cleanup
    exit 128
}

# Main execution with enhanced error handling
main() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}====================================${NC}"
    echo -e "${BLUE}  Ring -1 LiveCD Builder (RAM)${NC}"
    echo -e "${BLUE}  IOMMU Workarounds Included${NC}"
    echo -e "${BLUE}  Enhanced Error Recovery${NC}"
    echo -e "${BLUE}====================================${NC}"
    echo ""
    
    # Check if running as root
    if [ "$EUID" -ne 0 ]; then
        echo -e "${RED}[!] This script must be run as root${NC}"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Set enhanced trap handlers
    trap cleanup_on_exit EXIT
    trap 'cleanup_on_signal INT' INT
    trap 'cleanup_on_signal TERM' TERM
    trap 'cleanup_on_signal HUP' HUP
    
    # Execute build steps with error recovery
    check_requirements || exit 1
    
    setup_tmpfs || exit 1
    
    # Monitor memory before heavy operations
    if ! monitor_memory; then
